poem:
Title: To Merge or Not

In love's economy, their hearts a ledger,
Transactions measured, not in pounds but trust.
Their joint account, a pledge, a tender wager,
Hinging on faith's currency, robust.

Mikey, Jana, those trivial quarrels,
Take heed, 'tis not of pants or chores, the measure. 
Their worth in Kitty's cradle humbly carols,
The true wealth they hold, their love's dear treasure.
